item.title: First
item.description: Need for validation of clusters Clustering algorithms are designed such that they come out with a given number of clusters even if the underlying data is devoid of any such clusters. We will see a criterion to assess the credibility of the clusters produced by any clustering algorithm. Within-groups sum of squared distances (WSS): $$ WSS_k = \sum_{l=1}^k{\sum_{x_i \in {C_l}}{d^2(x_i, \overline{x_l})}} $$ where, $k$ is the number of clusters and within the l-th cluster $C_l$, $x_l$ is the centre of mass.
